<IfModule LiteSpeed>
RewriteEngine On
CacheLookup on

title: mastodon/activity.rb at main · mastodon/mastodon

last_post.content:
It answers my question. Unfortunately, I think you are to optimistic on how ActivityPub is implemented. If you look at Mastodon's source code here, you see that only objects of types: Note Question Image Audio Video Article Page Event can be parsed by Mastodon.

Basically, we need a best practice document here on how to treat unknown object types, and implementations to agree to it. Otherwise, this idea "ActivityStreams is easy to extend" will remain an ideal not reality.

Note that Target Encoding is a risky business: to avoid trivially leaking supervised signal into noisy features, it requires a implementing an internal cross-transform routine in its fit_transform(X_train) method which makes it behave differently that calling fit(X_train).transform(X_train) sequentially.

See the following educational non-regression test to see why its important on a minimal synthetic case:

https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/blob/main/sklearn/preprocessing/tests/test_target_encoder.py#L438

It will be part of scikit-learn 1.3.
